t: Set*pn the trumpet to your lips! One*ld like a vulture is over the house of the Lord,*s because*ln they have transgressed my covenant and*ld rebelled against my law.
To*ln me they cry, “My*ld God, we— Israel— know you.”
Israel*ln has spurned the good; the*ld enemy shall pursue him.
They*pn made kings, but not through me. They*ld set up princes, but I knew it not. With*ln their silver and gold they made idols for*ld their own destruction.
I*ln have spurned your calf, O Samaria. My*ld anger burns against them. How*ln long will they be incapable of innocence?
For*ln it is from Israel; a*ln craftsman made it; it*ld is not God. The*ln calf of Samaria shall*ld be broken to pieces.
For*pn they sow the wind, and*ld they shall reap the whirlwind. The*ln standing grain has no heads; it*ld shall yield no flour; if*ln it were to yield, strangers*ld would devour it.
Israel*ln is swallowed up; already*ld they are among the nations as*ld a useless vessel.
For*ln they have gone up to Assyria, a*ld wild donkey wandering alone; Ephraim*ld has hired lovers.
Though*ln they hire allies among the nations, I*ld will soon gather them up. And*ln the king and princes shall soon writhe because*ld of the tribute.
Because*pn Ephraim has multiplied altars for sinning, they*ld have become to him altars for sinning.
Were*ln I to write for him my laws by the ten thousands, they*ld would be regarded as a strange thing.

As*ln for my sacrificial offerings, they*ld sacrifice meat and eat it, but*ld the Lord*s does not accept them. Now*ln he will remember their iniquity and*ld punish their sins; they*ld shall return to Egypt.
For*ln Israel has forgotten his Maker and*ld built palaces, and*ln Judah has multiplied fortified cities; so*ld I will send a fire upon his cities, and*ld it shall devour her strongholds.
